revised_title: Hourly Barometer Observations and Their Impact on Meteorology
tldr: The author conducted extensive hourly observations on three barometers over a period of several months to study the diurnal variation of the barometer and its impact on meteorology. The observations were made at equal intervals of time, and the results were used to determine the laws that regulate the periodical changes in the barometer's readings. The findings could potentially improve weather prediction and understanding of atmospheric pressure.
